intro: Oxycoccoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved oxycocco, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and produces clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant is typically found in acidic, well-drained soils in forested areas. It has a compact growth habit and is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value. Oxycoccoides is also valued for its ability to thrive in shaded environments.
